title:
Effective Field Theory Calculation of LIGO-like Compton Scattering and
  Experiment Proposal for Graviton Detection
abstract:
Despite the lack of a universally accepted quantum gravity theory, gravitons
are considered the quantum noise in gravitational waves. Wave mediation
requires that gravitons be in a coherence state, with an abundance number of
order $\sim10^{79}$. Thus, the detection of coherent-state gravitons may be
possible in a LIGO-like experiment via Compton scattering with a nanospherical
test mass. This work presents the associating scattering amplitude calculation
using effective field theory, calculating a total cross section approximately
$100 ~\mathrm{cm^2}$ for a coherence state and $\sim10^{-81}~\mathrm{m^2}$ for
a single graviton. An experiment proposal involving levitation techniques of a
nanosphere is given in full description.
